inputs:
Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context: 
A: What can I do for you? 
B: Yes, I made a reservation for <MASK> for April 3rd to 6th, and my name is Sara. 
A: Yes, what's the problem? 
B: Well, I want to extend it for 2 more nights. 
A: So you will stay until 9th? 
B: Yes. 
A: OK, we'll make the correction for you. 
B: Thank you. 
  choice: 3 days
  choice: 3 months 
  choice: 6 seconds 
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context:
A: Excuse me. What's the actual flying time from here to San Francisco?
B: It's <MASK>.
A: Can you tell me what time we're arriving?
B: Sure. Let me see... at 6:15 a. m. local time tomorrow.
A: I see.
B: And that'll be 10:15 p. m. Taipei time.
  choice: 6 hours 15 minutes 
  choice: About eleven and half hours 
  choice: About one hour 
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context:
A: Good afternoon, Sir. You're here to see about a Temporary Loan, right? The loans we offer are for purchasing income-generating assets. Is that what you require?
B: Yes, that's exactly what I need. How about terms for these?
A: Well, we offer 60 - day or 90 - day loans. The balance of the loan is to be repaid in full by the end of the specified period.
B: Is there any flexibility on that?
A: Unfortunately, not.
B: OK. In my position, I think the best way to go would be for the <MASK> loan. That would give us a little more time to sort out the repayment plan.
A: Not a problem, Sir. If you'd just fill out these forms, and of course with necessary clearance, we can get you the money right away.
  choice: 5 - year
  choice: 6 - day
  choice: 60 - day
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context: 
A: Hello, IBA Bank, how can I help you? 
B: Hello, I'd like to talk to someone about making a withdrawal. 
A: You can withdraw money from your account either over the counter or via the ATM. 
B: Yes, but the problem is that I have a Savings Account with you, and I need to take some money from that. Do I really have to give <MASK> notice if I want my money? 
A: Actually, you only need to give 7 days notice if you wish to withdraw funds. Of course, you will lose some interest due to the withdrawal. 
B: That's not a problem. I'll pop in later today to make a formal request. Thanks ! 
  choice: 7 minutes
  choice: 90 days
  choice: one year
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context:
A: Can you tell me what's included in your warranty?
B: Certainly. The product has a two-year guarantee. If it breaks down during that period we offer a replacement unit completely free of charge. Our products are very reliable but we recommend you take out an extended warranty. This covers you for a further two years.
A: I see. What does that include?
B: It covers all parts and labour, except for normal wear and tear of course.
A: What sort of response time do you guarantee?
B: Our engineers are on call 24 hours a day. We guarantee someone will be with you within <MASK>, but in practice it's often much sooner.
A: Are there any exclusions?
B: Not really. It's a very comprehensive warranty. I'll put a copy in the post to you and you can read through the small print.
  choice: 24 hours
  choice: three hours
  choice: two minutes
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context: 
A: are you ready for the meeting? 
B: yes, come on in. how's your new job going? 
A: it's challenging, but I'm enjoying it quite a bit. 
B: that's great. I knew you'd do a good job as a manager. 
A: thanks a lot. 
B: how's your assistant manager getting on? 
A: well, that's part of the problem. His probation period is up tomorrow and I don't think he's ready to pass. 
B: what seems to be the problem? 
A: well, he was supposed to be able to learn his job in <MASK>, but he just doesn't seem to know what he's doing. 
B: if you gave him another 30 days, do you think he could figure it out by then? 
A: to be honest, he has no authority. He's a hard-worker, but no one listens to him. 
B: I see. Not everyone is cut out to work in management. 
A: I know. It'd be great if we could transfer him to a department where he doesn't have to work with people. 
B: there's an opening in the creative design department. It involves working with computers. 
A: that's perfect. I'll let him know tomorrow. Thanks ! 
  choice: 30 days
  choice: 30 seconds
  choice: 5 years
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context:
A: Which route are you interested in?
B: I think <MASK>'tour from New York to Atlantic City will be fine.
A: That's a good choice.
B: What is the departure date?
A: We have parties every Saturday from June to October.
  choice: the five days
  choice: the five seconds
  choice: the five years
<MASK> phrase:

Question: Which phrase best fits the <MASK> span? Context:
A: Excuse me. I've been waiting for my main dish for quite a time.
B: Yes, sir.Just a minute, please, I'll check with the kitchen.
A: Thank you for waiting.It takes <MASK>, I'm afraid.
B: We have an appointment in half an hour.
A: I see.
B: Do you have anything else I can have instead?
A: Well, yes.How about beef stew? We can serve you at once.
B: I'll take beef stew, then.
  choice: another 50 to 60 minutes
  choice: another fifteen to twenty minutes
  choice: another ten to fifteen seconds
